sentence.text: He stopped and looked down at her .
Broussac , on our way home , stopped to jeer in at the lighted windows of Master Ferrebourg 's office .
But we did not stop at the café .
The woman , from Heywood , near Rochdale , had stopped to look at directions in Farnworth near Manchester when the man struck at 5.40am on Saturday .
At 8.00 we stopped at the foot of the Cavales Ridge and roped up .
He stopped in a parking area with a padlocked toilet and a bin surrounded by litter , and dug out his road atlas from among the week 's newspapers .
She stopped for a moment to say hello to the woman at the desk , then took the lift to the third floor operating theatres .
He stopped , staring at her , appalled by the likeness , then went across and stood by the open hatchway , looking outwards , his neat-cut hair barely moving in the icy wind .
She stopped next to him but he ignored her and kept on walking .
Ash stopped so suddenly I wondered where she 'd gone for a moment .
Theda stopped still suddenly and faced him .
We reached his office where he said he had some paperwork to complete before we stopped fairly soon for ten minutes at Kenora .
He spotted her immediately and strolled across , stopping on the way to have a few words with the patron .
Nathan passed through the curtain and stopped at the top of the steps .
She stopped in mid-prowl , tapping one finger thoughtfully against her lip .
Sophie stopped in the act of tidying up the table .
Cross the border by the afternoon and stop in Tijuana .
At junctions with a stop sign and a solid white line across your approach , you must stop at the line , wait for a safe gap in the traffic before you move .
The dog usually just stops dead or veers off on a different course .
He stopped abruptly , swinging round to face her , the moonlight revealing his expression to be slightly bewildered .
